column1: This course addresses the key role of leaders in educational systems for the development, articulation, implementation, and supervision of an assessment process that provides accountability for all stakeholders-students, parents, teachers, legislators, relevant communities, and governing authorities.  Issues of philosophy, standards, outcomes, curricula, instrumentation, technology, and the interconnected nature of these factors are identified as they influence the leadership role in accountability compliance.  Factors related to ethical practice and social justice anchor the philosophical and political parameters of the course.
